intro: Echites darienensis, commonly known as the Darien spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
